title: Yes, it's true
body:
The Moxie will be opening its doors to the public on September 21st, 2008... just kidding! 2006. No? Not good enough for you? Fine. We'll open on September 21st, 2005. Geesh. We sent out a flurry of press releases today, announcing our grand opening, so don't be surprised if you see a rash of Moxie-related stories cropping up in your favorite Springfield-based tabloid.

As for the theater itself, the bathrooms are finished; the Cinebar is in the final throes of finishment (not a word), and the terrazzo floors STILL aren't finished (more on that later). We've had a few setbacks with our film schedule, but all in all we're very pleased with the line-up we have for late September / October. We will be printing and distributing a monthly calendar with all of our movies, so keep your eye out for those in mid-September.

We'll also be doing a few days of invitational "test screenings" before the grand opening, wherein a certain amount of lucky Moxie supporters will be invited to the theater for a free showing. I have every intention of setting up one (maybe two showings) for blog readers... after all, you guys have been our biggest supporters... but I need to see a show of hands for those that would like to attend. I'll most likely set up an online RSVP system, but I need to determine whether we'll need one or two showings to fit in all my weirdo blog readers. If this sounds like something you'd like to do, give me a YAY in the comments.

PS - Founding Members needn't give a yay, as you already have your own party in the works.
author: Dan

comments.author: Tristor
comments.body:
I've drove by on my way home from school (I'm an OTC student) at the behest of one of your loyal readers in PA. I was curious if cameras were allowed as my friend from PA would like me to attend and get some photographs of the place.  Looks interesting.  He mentioned that you were having a second open house this Friday (Sept 2nd) from 7-10PM.

Sorry for this being off topic.

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body:
If I had $500,
I’d found in the morning,
I’d found in the evening,
All over the Moxie

I’d found out danger,
I’d found out a warning,
I’d found out love between my brothers and my sisters,
All over the Moxie.
